title: Fulham 0-3 Arsenal: The Gunners sailed to a 3-0 win over Fulham
body:
....... Arsenal progressed five points exact at the Premier League peak with a persuading 3-0 win at Fulham on Sunday, as Leandro Trossard made set record with a hat-trick of first-half assists.

The Gunners further underlined their purpose to end a 19-year hold since their last top-flight title, Eurosport reports

A two-goal explosion in a five-minute period midway through the opening term saw Brazilian's Gabriel and Gabriel Martinelli nod home simple headers. It took the latter's tally to a personal best of 12 league goals so far this term and five in his last five league outings.

Martin Odegaard then put the result beyond doubt on the stroke of half-time as he took down Trossard's cross and rifled past Bernd Leno. The contribution from the Belgian forward saw him become the first player in Premier League history to clock up a trio of assists in the first half of an away game.

Fulham improved following the break and went close when Tosin Adarabioyo headed against the crossbar.

However, Arsenal continued to comfortably contain their hosts and control the game and were given a further boost 13 minutes from time when Gabriel Jesus came off the bench to make his first appearance since undergoing knee surgery in December.

The result means Arsenal are five points ahead of title rivals Manchester City with 11 matches apiece still to play.

Fulham stay eighth but have played more games than their rivals for the European places.

Next, Arsenal engage Sporting Lisbon in the Europa League Last 16 on Thursday before hosting Crystal Palace in the Premier League on Sunday. Fulham are also in action that day when they visit Manchester United in the FA Cup quarter-finals.

title: EPL: Arteta responds to Guardiola's comment on favourite team to win title
body:
Arsenal boss Mikel Arteta has waved aside Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola's title mind games.

Arteta insisted that the Gunners are just focusing on taking each day as they come.

Arsenal beat Fulham 3-0 on Sunday with Leandro Trossard setting up each of Gabriel Magalhaes, Gabriel Martinelli and Martin Odegaard goals.

A day earlier, Manchester City managed to beat Crystal Palace with Erling Haaland finding the back of the net from the penalty spot.

Shortly after the Man City game Guardiola claimed Arsenal were still big favourites for the title.

Asked about Guardiola's comments, Arteta responded: "I don't know.

"We just discuss what we discuss internally: to be really humble, to work on the next training session and try to be better every day.

"This is our focus. There is still a huge part of the season to be completed."

title: EPL: Arteta reacts to Arsenal fans' chant of title victory song
body:
Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta has said that he would join fans of the club to chant about winning the league this season

During their 3-0 victory over Fulham on Sunday Arsenal fans could be heard loudly chanting the title victory song.

The victory took them back to five points above Manchester City in the Premier League table.

Manchester City had earlier managed a 1-0 victory against Crystal Palace to reduce the gap to just three, mounting pressure on Arsenal.

Arteta was asked about the chanting by the fans, he said, "I would be singing with them to support the team, that's for sure! They've been exceptional.

'The amount of people we had coming here, their attitude, their passion, the energy that they're putting in is incredible.

"And we're going to need that and that's a game-changer for us, so thank you!"

title: Arsenal eases past Fulham to re-establish five-point gap - The Sun Nigeria
body:
Leandro Trossard set up all three goals as Arsenal re-established a five-point cushion at the top of the Premier League with a 3-0 win at Fulham.

It was all too easy for the Gunners at Craven Cottage as the hosts struggled to find any foothold in the game.

Gabriel Magalhaes nodded in a Trossard corner in the 21st minute to spark a quick flurry of goals that would put the visitors out of reach.

Gabriel Martinelli added a second five minutes later, with Martin Odegaard all but securing the victory just before half time.

Marco Silva's side keenly felt the absence of Joao Palhinha as the team slumped to a second straight defeat, coinciding with his two-match ban, with Arsenal having no trouble parting the Fulham midfield.

title: EPL: Mikel Arteta reveals big boost to Arsenal's title challenge
body:
Mikel Arteta has identified the return of Gabriel Jesus as a major boost to Arsenal's title challenge.

The Gunners beat Fulham away at Craven Cottage on Sunday to reclaim their five-point lead over Manchester City in the league table.

Brazil duo of Gabriel Magalhaes, Gabriel Martinelli and Martin Odegaard were the scorers, while former Brighton star, Leandro Trossard provided a hat-trick of assists.

Leading 3-0 with 15 minutes to normal time, Mikel Arteta subbed on Gabriel Jesus for his first appearance for the Gunners in around four months.

The Brazil international has been injured and on the sideline since after the World Cup in December 2022.

And Arteta was thrilled to see him back and looking sharp.

Speaking about the Brazilian's return, the Spaniard told reporters, "Big boost. First step today, and we didn't know if it was the right game for him today. A few days ago he said to me, 'I'm still missing something'.

"Yesterday, I looked him in his eyes and he said, 'I'm ready'. So I said, 'Okay'. So then we had the opportunity to throw him in, which is the first step to giving him that boost."

title: 'Unbelievable addition, a blessing' - Ian Wright hails Arsenal's new signing
body:
Arsenal legend, Ian Wright, has hailed the club's January signing, Leandro Trossard, for his performance against Fulham in Sunday's Premier League 3-0 win.

Wright said that Trossard, who moved to Emirates Stadium from Brighton in January, is a blessing to Arsenal's squad, adding that his addition to Mikel Arteta's team is unbelievable.

Trossard registered a hat-trick of assists in the first half during Arsenal's Premier League win over Fulham.

The Belgian set up the likes of Gabriel Magalhaes, Gabriel Martinelli and Martin Odegaard on the scoresheet for the Gunners.

"Since he has [Trossard] come, he has contributed right from the off, They could not get near him, in his movement, whether he came in from the left or he came from the centre. He can get himself in this position (goalscoring positions) and not panic," Wright told Premier League Production.

"When you consider the signings we were trying to make and we ended up getting someone like Trossard, it was a blessing. He has come into the team, and he has hit the ground running.

"When you've a player of that calibre, who is a very, very good player. To get a signing like that, who can come in and be up to speed, is invaluable to us. He's shown that from the first game until now. He has been an unbelievable addition to the squad," he added.

title: EPL: Too happy - Vinicius sends message to Arsenal star after latest win
body:
Real Madrid winger, Vinicius Jr, has sent a message to Arsenal striker, Gabriel Jesus, after the former Manchester City returned to action for the Gunners.

Vinicius expressed his delight at seeing his international teammate Jesus back in action for Arsenal.

Jesus made his first appearance for Mikel Arteta's side since the 2022 FIFA World Cup break during the clash against Fulham over the weekend.

He suffered a knee injury during the 2022 FIFA World Cup and had to undergo surgery.

Jesus came off the bench as goals from Gabriel Magalhaes, Gabriel Martinelli, and Martin Odegaard gave Arsenal a 3-0 victory over Fulham.

After the game, Jesus posted a photo of himself coming onto the pitch during the Fulham match and captioned it: "So happy to be back. And feels like I never left... What a win from this group! Let's go, gunners!

title: Arsenal Starts Count Down To Premier League Title Win
body:
Arsenal were in action on Sunday against Fulham. The Premier League table-toppers smashed the in-form side 3-0 away from home.

Goals from Gabriel, Martinelli, and Ødegaard did the job for coach Mikel Arteta's side at the Craven Cottage.

The 3-0 win has extended Arsenal's points to a massive 66 points in 27 games, five huge points above second-placed Manchester City who currently have 61 points in 27 games.

As it stands, Manchester City and Arsenal both have 11 games each to play before the season ends.

Before City can overtake Arsenal, coach Pep Guardiola and his boys must win all their remaining eleven games and pray that Arteta's boys suffer at least two defeats before the season ends.

While City are racking their brains over that, Arsenal have started counting down to the end of the season already.

After their 3-0 win over Fulham on Sunday, the entire team members posed with a giant clock which is seen as a cryptic message that it is Arsenal's time to lift the Premier League title.

On the clock, the long hand was on 11 which signifies that the team has just eleven games to play to be crowned the 2022-2023 Premier League champions.

Note that Arsenal have won the First Division/Premier League title 13 times in their history. The last time they won the league title was in the 2003-2004 season. This means that the last time the Gunners won the league was almost 20 years ago.

title: EPL: Gabriel Jesus will cause problems at Arsenal - Merson
body:
Arsenal legend, Paul Merson has said that Gabriel Jesus' return from injury could cause problems at the club.

Jesus made his return to Mikel Arteta's squad during the 3-0 win at Fulham on Sunday.

The Brazil international picked up a knee injury during the World Cup in December and had to undergo surgery.

In his absence, Eddie Nketiah has started upfront for Arsenal, while Leandro Trossard also arrived from Brighton.

Merson has now hinted at selection headaches for Arteta.

He told Sky Sports: "Gabriel Jesus coming back is a bit of a problem for Arsenal because the lad will want to play - he didn't sign to be a bit-part player like he was at Man City.

"It will cause problems in time but at the moment it's like another signing."

title: EPL: Merson gives Arsenal condition to win title ahead of Man City
body:
Arsenal legend, Paul Merson has said that his former club must go into the final eight Premier League fixtures five points clear if they want to win the title.

The Gunners are currently five points ahead of Manchester City with 11 rounds of matches left.

Mikel Arteta's men will have the chance to extend it to eight points when they host Crystal Palace this weekend, with City having to play a FA Cup tie.

Merson said on Sky Sports: "If Arsenal play first and they keep going eight points clear with City needing to win to make it five, before you know it, it will take its toll. It happened with Tottenham and Leicester in 2016.

"If Arsenal win their next two games against Palace and Leeds, I don't see how they can be stopped.

"They'll be five points clear at least with eight games to go. They've got to play Manchester City but they will have to win that game."
